update.description:
added [tinyobjloader](https://github.com/syoyo/tinyobjloader) in `deps` dir that does the bulk of the work for parsing and loading the obj mesh and material (.mtl) files

The `OBJLoader` class takes the data from `tinyobjloader` and constructs the gazebo mesh and material objects. Nothing fancy like reusing vertex/normal/uv data is done in this version.  

Here's an [example gazebo cordless drill model](https://www.dropbox.com/s/pmi8nc2joewccsf/cordless_drill_obj.zip?dl=0) that uses a .obj mesh

jenkins:

- [nvidia-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/640/) - ok

- not sure why the [abi checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/90/) is not working
update.title: Add support for loading wavefront obj mesh files

content.raw: Great, thanks. It still seems to me that there could be multiple raw pointers to the same Material added to a mesh that would all be deleted in [~Mesh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/73fae73d688a67241403ed58636f5da0fd72e314/gazebo/common/Mesh.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Mesh.cc-54). I haven't seen any `double free` errors, though when running this.
content.html: Great, thanks. It still seems to me that there could be multiple raw pointers to the same Material added to a mesh that would all be deleted in ~Mesh. I haven't seen any double free errors, though when running this.

The `OBJLoader` class takes the data from `tinyobjloader` and constructs the gazebo mesh and material objects. Nothing fancy like reusing vertex/normal/uv data is done in this version.

pull_request.title: Add support for loading wavefront obj mesh files

pullrequest.title: Add support for loading wavefront obj mesh files

content.raw:
turns out obj assigns a material for each face in the mesh but gazebo assigns materials on the submesh level so I updated the code to create a new gazebo submesh per unique material. 574a917

The textures in the cloverleave interchange model should load properly now.
content.html:
turns out obj assigns a material for each face in the mesh but gazebo assigns materials on the submesh level so I updated the code to create a new gazebo submesh per unique material. 574a917

The textures in the cloverleave interchange model should load properly now.

content.raw: actually, the `materialIds` map is just used within the duration of the `Load` function so it won't be holding onto material pointers. I made it a local variable within the function. 4d7b630
content.html: actually, the materialIds map is just used within the duration of the Load function so it won't be holding onto material pointers. I made it a local variable within the function. 4d7b630
